title: Rowdies defender arrested for cocaine possession
text:

Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1LGv7ti Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Rowdies defender arrested for cocaine possession 10 News Staff, WTSP 1:09 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 William 'Willie' Hunt CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Tampa, Florida -- A Tampa Bay Rowdies defender was arrested Sunday night in Ybor City after police found a half-gram of cocaine in his pocket. 
Hillsborough Sheriff's deputies say William "Willie" Hunt was with three others in a car near 9th Avenue and 15th Street when they passed a police cruiser and the officers smelled a strong odor of marijuana coming from the car. 
The officer put the cruiser in reverse and that's when all of the guys jumped out of the car. 
The officers searched the car and each individual. There was another bag of drugs on the ground that apparently had been thrown down, police said, but officers couldnâ€™t determine who it belonged to. 
Hunt, 28, was arrested and charged with possession of cocaine. He has since been released on bond. 
The Tampa Bay Rowdies signed Willie Hunt on Wednesday, Oct. 7. He played for the Rowdies in 2014, making 12 appearances, including 11 starts. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1LGv7ti TOP VIDEOS
